DataElement.preferredName: Computed Tomography Simulation No Success Reason Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe why a plan for radiation therapy that insures the target area is precisely located and marked using computed tomography (CT) was not successfully completed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Computed Tomography Simulation No Success Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis._In cancer treatment, a process used to plan radiation therapy so that the target area is precisely located and marked._The non-affirmative response to a question._An event that accomplishes its intended purpose._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.:In cancer treatment, a process used to plan radiation therapy so that the target area is precisely located and marked.

Concepts.definition: A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

A technique which attempts to provide an abstract model of a particular system. It utilizes a mathematical model, which attempts to predict the behavior of the system from a set of parameters and initial conditions.
